page.title: 04Wall Paintings
page.content: There are also some magnificent wall paintings in the Nave on the East wall above the chancel arch. The paintings are thought to be of Anglo Saxon date. The picture is said to be of Christ in majesty within a mandorla supported by four flying angels. Their date is now believed to be about 960 AD. This is the only Saxon wall painting in it,s original place. Above the replaced pillar in the south wall a late 15th century painting represents a warning to Sabbath breakers.There is a figure of christ dressed only in a loin cloth . It is said if you break the Sabbath you put a wound on Christ's body. There is also a mural of St.George and the Dragon. Christianity is shown by St.George and Evil by the Dragon.
